Posts.Content: Thanks for everybody's kind and supportive words it really helps.  I have told my daughter but have watered things down.  I just explained that a have a lump that is cancer but I am getting it removed and having treatment to make sure it is gone for good!  She seems to be coping fine which I am really pleased about as really do not want this to affect her.  I just feel so helpless and at the mercy of this horrible disease xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I have been diagnosed with stage 2 breast cancer IDC.  Since the diagnosis I keep having fears which are hopefully irrational that the cancer will spread.  I feel tired all the time and neck feels stiff and sore.  Don't know how I going to cope until I have surgery in a month' time.  Has anybody else had the same symptoms after Diagnosis?
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Joanne it is really appreciated.  Operation is not until 8th March which is also making me anxious as seems ages away!  I am having a lumpectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy to see if the cancer has spread.  I have a 12 year old daughter and supportive husband and am really trying to be strong xx
